title: The Art of Persuasion in Leadership
description: One-minute skill: The Art of Persuasion in Leadership.

hook.text: Lincoln didn't order his cabinet to agree. He persuaded them â€” often by letting them think the idea was theirs.

buildup.text: Persuasion in leadership means influencing others without relying on authority or coercion.

discovery.text: Aristotle's framework still works: ethos (credibility), pathos (emotion), and logos (logic).

twist.text: Data alone rarely persuades. People decide emotionally first, then justify rationally.

climax.text: Mandela persuaded prison guards to respect him by learning their language and culture. Influence, not force.

punchline.text: The strongest leaders persuade. The weakest ones command.
